channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Quant who said passive era is ‘worse than Marxism’ doubles down
item.description: Inigo Fraser Jenkins calls it a “dystopian symbiosis”: a feedback loop between index funds and platform giants like Apple, Microsoft and Nvidia.

item.title: 22-year-old Australian TikToker raises $1.7 million for 88-year-old Michigan grocer after chance encounter weeks earlier
item.description: Ed Bambas will soon ring up his last can of corn. The 88-year-old Michigan grocery worker was handed an oversized check for $1.7 million Friday, the r...

item.title: Olivia Nuzzi to leave Vanity Fair while denouncing ex-fiance Ryan Lizza’s Substack attack as ‘fiction-slash-revenge porn’
item.description: Through a miserable week as her "American Canto" was panned and scandalous revelations mounted, Nuzzi posted about “Signs Your Book Rollout Has Gone A...

item.title: A Thanksgiving dealmaking sprint helped Netflix win Warner Bros.
item.description: While most Americans were feasting, Netflix executives and advisers hunkered down to finalize a binding offer and a $59 billion bridge loan.

item.title: ‘Its own research shows they encourage addiction’: Highest court in Mass. hears case about Instagram, Facebook effect on kids
item.description: The lawsuit claims Meta designed features to make them addictive and that its actions affected hundreds of thousands of Massachusetts teenagers.
